title: Bentley's Oyster Bar restaurant review: catch a table for the freshest shellfish in London
text:
Bentley’s celebrated 100 years of trading in 2016 but I wonder if it will make it to its bicentenary. Scientists reckon that at current rates of over fishing, the oceans will be empty of everything except plastic by the middle of this century, a piscine apocalypse which sucks almost as badly as a paper straw and is the most compelling reason I can think of to join the dancing policeman at the next Extinction Rebellion bop.

It turns out that there aren’t plenty more fish in the sea, which should at least provide a crumb of consolation the next time someone tries to buck you up for being dumped. If there’s no longer anything nice to eat, who needs someone to go for dinner with?
description: Bentley’s celebrated 100 years of trading in 2016 but I wonder if it will make it to its bicentenary.
